item.title: How does god handle eternity?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 hour ago, Nate0068 said:

wouldn't this turn into a hell for him since he’s done everything there is to do eventually and now he is just repeating the same things over for eternity?

No because creation is endless. God itself cannot ever reach its own end because it has no beginning or end.

You can count up the natural numbers forever without ever repeating one. Give it a try.

item.title: Why is this explanation for conciousness insufficient? It is self-contained.
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Pure foolishness.

Where did the universe come from? What is existence? Why does it exist? How was it created? Why was it created?

item.title: Projections, awakening and purification
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
6 minutes ago, BETGR164128 said:

@mandyjw @mandyjwok, but there is an outside world?

No!

There is only your mind.

But your mind is identical to the whole world and other people.

You imagine the entire universe because you are God pretending to be human. You are one. There cannot be anything outside of you.

All outsides are inside your mind.

item.title: kambo healing
item.description:
in Health, Fitness, Nutrition

Kambo will make you vomit your guts out.

But that can be healing.

You can use the search function to find some old threads about peoples' experiences with it.

I wouldn't expect it to heal serious things like Alzheimers. But it might heal you at the mental/spiritual level, helping you shed some ego.

Kambo is not a psychedelic at all. It is a poison. It's basically like deliberately getting bit by a snake just for the experience.

item.title: how can you be concious if you are made of conciousness?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

You are consciousness itself and consciousness has infinite capacity for self-awareness precisely because it is itself.

item.title: difference between being self aware and being concious
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

When you are being aware that you are human, you are actually misunderstanding what you are. You are imagining that you are human, in the same way that you could imagine that you are a kangaroo. But that doesn't make you a kangaroo. Only in your mind.

In fact, you are God. But you are too busy imagining you are human to notice this. The human obscures the God like clouds the sun.

It would be my first ,,psychedelic'' trip, sinse the substance is easily accessable

item.title: Why is health care for all a human right?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
56 minutes ago, Raphael said:

I'm emotionally very detached from people and even from my family, so many times I have trouble understanding why people gets so emotional. I also have trouble to understand why people get attached to me. But of course they are nuances here and I'm sure that if it was a life/death situation for my mom I would be affected. I was affected affected even if it was not highly when my grandpa died three years ago.

As you do more of this work you will become more compassionate with regards to the needless suffering of others.

You need a heart awakening to really start to care about people. Most peoples' hearts are so closed and all they care about is themselves. But you cannot create a well-functioning and healthy community that way.

Imagine a family in which no one cared about the others. It would be a toxic disaster.

item.title: Empty?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@pregnantplatypuss Of course everything is ultimately Empty.

But that doesn't mean you can't be passionate about your LP.

But also, if you're first starting to become conscious of the existential Emptiness of life, that will likely rob you of motivation and make you depressed for a short period of time until you integrate it and the ego gets over it.

A sense of meaninglessness and loss is a common egoic reaction to deep consciousness work. It will pass once you go deeper. It is one of the many threshold guardians which guard the deepest Truth.

Trust that your sense of passion will come back even stronger once you fully awaken. But also be open to your passions changing and evolving. Maybe your passion for your current work will die completely but that's because some new greater passion with take its place. Be open to that.

Remember, the ego will go through a period of mourning its own death. Just like it does with the death of a loved one. There is a period of resistance, emotional upheaval, depression, then acceptance, letting go, and moving on.

item.title: Spiral Dynamics Stage Yellow Examples Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
3 hours ago, Keyhole said:

Not sure if this is been posted if it has I am sorry.  It is pretty good.

Of course authoritarianism exists precisely because it works.

But it only works up to a certain point.

At higher levels of consciousness it stops working and becomes counter-productive.

So yes, at certain (low) levels of consciousness you have to be a dick to be successful.

But at the highest levels of consciousness being a dick will not work.

Not understanding that there are different levels of consciousness and that your followers have different levels of consciousness and different systems of values will make this guy's analysis and interviews incomplete.

There are many different leadership styles which correspond to consciousness and values levels. Not to mention that you someone cannot escape being a dick if they are stuck in a certain level of consciousness. The leader himself has to grow massively to stop being authoritarian and yet remain effective. This is not easy to do for most people. Which is why its so rare and authoritarianism and abuse of power is so common.

item.title: Difference between god-self and no-self?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
30 minutes ago, Mongu9719 said:

@Leo Gura in one of your videos you said that we can become aware of no-self and then we can become aware of god-self. What did you mean by this?

You can become aware that a glass is half-empty, and then aware that the glass is half-full, and then aware that the glass is you.

item.title: On Leo's comments at 6:00 in How Psychedelics Work
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 hours ago, wheelspawn said:

I have been doing meditation, contemplation, lucid dreaming and psychedelics for many, many years. Among other things. I too awoke from the dream of reality and became God on LSD; what more is there to say? I have had many deeply profound experiences on them. I concluded that they were nonveridical. I have no problem concluding that. The loss to me is zero.

Your conclusions come from a lack of understanding and depth.

You don't understand how deep the mind goes. A few trips is not enough to understand.

Quote

If you want another example, I remember "directly experiencing" a tree talking to me on acid. Funny enough, it sounded almost exactly like one of the ents from the Lord of the Rings movies. Was the tree actually talking? Of course not.

This clearly shows you are not conscious that your mind is constructing all of realty.

All of reality is imaginary. So whatever you imagine become actual. There is no difference since all difference is relative and imaginary.

Quote

"You just haven't introspected enough", you might say. I have to do x, y and z. I haven't smoked this. I haven't practiced that.

That's right. You're still locked into the materialist paradigm. You believe in an objective, external reality independent of your mind. But no such thing exists.

Quote

Your background presuppositions are kicking in again. You are thinking I am some kind of novice, but you don't know that.

Your are projecting.

I know you're clearly not awake. And because you are not awake you cannot understand how I know that you are not awake. But it's obvious you are not awake. And this cannot be explained to you because if you could understand it, you'd be awake. But you aren't.

Quote

Moreover, I am not going to follow you off a cliff.

Awakening is more radical than jumping off a cliff.

You don't need to follow me. The Truth is the Truth and you can discover it on your own in many different ways. I am merely offering a helping hand to those you want it.

Quote

I am not going to do something reckless and dangerous like smoke DPT 50 times.

Yes, you are afraid. I understand that. Your entire life is dominated by survival and fear of death. That's what keeps you from awakening.

Smoking DPT 50 times is not dangerous if done properly. Nor do you have to smoke DPT at all. You could simply do some hardcore meditation or self-inquiry. DPT would just be a shortcut since I know how lazy you are. Your mind is too lazy to meditate for 30 days straight. So something like DPT is useful.

Quote

You have claimed, at various times, to be disembodied, immortal and omniscient. You claim to not have a brain or body. You have transcripts of word-for-word conversations with Infinite Intelligence and claim to have tapped into collective consciousness, a move that allowed you to rewire the brains of fetuses to make them more open-minded.

Yes, I am God. That is Absolute Truth.

Do you want me to lie and say I am not God when I clearly am? That would be a lie. Whether your mind likes the Truth or not is not my concern. That is your own limitation to transcend.

Saying I am God does not make me superior to you, since God is all things. I am fully conscious that I am you. But you are not fully conscious that you are me. That's the only difference. There is no superior or inferior in the mind of God.

I know that I am God. But you do not know that you are God. So here I am trying to help you to understand that you are God. And here you are resisting it with all your ability. Because if you realized you are God, you would die to being a human. Fear of death has completely warped your mind such that you cannot understand my communication. Your mind is ensuring that you misunderstand me because it cannot allow you to understand me. That's too dangerous from your limited human POV. I understand all this, but you do not. And I understand why. Therefore I have compassion for you. You are afraid and you do not know who to trust. And it cannot be otherwise.

Quote

If you are as omniscient as you claim, your powers should be easily demonstrable. I would gladly leave behind my materialist leanings upon seeing the proper demonstrations. You call me close-minded, yet here I am offering you a clear channel to change my mind.

The ego mind desires demonstrations. Awakening has nothing to do with manipulating realty. Awakening is the realization that everything is exactly as it is.

No one can awaken you but yourself. God will never force itself on you. I am not going to play your games of trying to change your mind because your mind is not interested in change. Your mind is closed and you are not interested in serious inquiry as is clear by your arrogant attitude and lack of serious work. If you were doing serious work you would  not be on this forum arguing with me and asking for demonstrations. You would deep in meditation & contemplation trying to realize the Truth for yourself. But you are not at this point yet because you're very early in your journey. You are skeptical, and I totally get that. But you must understand that from my POV your skepticism is as silly as a child doubting that 1+1=2. It is a waste of time to even entertain such skepticism from an awakened position. Absolute Truth is prior to any possible skepticism or doubt because it is not a function of thought, belief, or mind. Absolute Truth cannot be thought, so it cannot be doubted either.

Quote

Why not do something like use Infinite Intelligence to discover a working HIV or coronavirus vaccine? Prove P=NP or the Riemann Hypothesis? Or sequester every molecule of carbon dioxide out of the atmosphere to stop climate change? Why not predict the next stock that is about to explode? I'm sure you could find a way to make the winnings serve the will of God, if that is a precondition.

Because all "use", utility, and value is a fiction. Nothing needs to be changed. Reality is Absolute Perfection. But you are too busy looking for utility, too busy manipulating reality to awaken to this fact. You want to drag God down into the domain of survival, thinking this will prove God. But this assumes survival is a true domain. In fact, survival is the domain of falsehood so God has no business there. God does not care about survival. It is beneath God. So rather than trying to drag God down to your level you must be willing to raise yourself up to God's level.

The will of God is EVERYTHING! That's what you don't fathom. Nothing can happen which isn't the will of God. The whole planet could die tomorrow and it would be perfectly fine. Realizing this creates liberation since there is no need to manipulate anything. Manipulation is a function of survival which is falsehood. To God it does not matter what happens because God's mind is conscious enough to see that all value and judgment is falsehood. No state of reality is better or worse than any other. So there is no need to change it. Awakening does not grant the ego the ability to manipulate the world using God's will, rather it eliminates the ego entirely, surrendering you to God will precisely as it is. It is the ego-mind which wants to use God's powers to manipulate the world. And that is precisely what God will not allow because that would be to allow devilry to flourish.

If you wish to access God, the cost is total surrender of your self. You must give up all of your attachments and demands. Which, of course, is the last thing you want to do. You want to hijack God for your selfish purposes. If you could, you would try to use God to become a tyrant over men. You would try to use God to get sex, power, money, luxury, and everything else your impure ego craves. And this is precisely what you are denied. Because that is devilry.

Quote

If that is too much effort, why not use your omniscience to tell me the title of the one book that is currently sitting on my desk? Or the text on the t-shirt I wore today. Easy.

Omniscience isn't what you imagine it to be. It is not a knowledge of relative things. It is Absolute Consciousness. All knowledge is finite and relative. I don't know what you had for breakfast. But I am conscious of how I create the entire universe. That's the paradox of awakening.

Quote

Like I said, I would gladly drop materialism/dualism if I saw these demonstrations. If you don't like my proposals, think of a better one. I await your response.

That is your problem. You fundamentally misunderstand this work. This work is not about me convincing you of anything. This work requires that you be willing to surrender your arrogant mind in a personal search for Truth. You have to want the Truth so bad that it will literally kill you. And that is precisely what you don't want. So you will never find the Truth and I will never be able to convince you otherwise. Because your entire attitude comes from fear. You don't care about Truth, your mind is just acting out survival mechanisms.

Quote

I am also curious about one more thing. I remember watching a video of yours where you stated that science will be done non-symbolically 500 years from now. What did you mean by that exactly? Are you thinking that the nondual paradigm would affect scientific research traditions for the better? Can you give me a brief sketch of what this would look like, especially in areas like neuroscience, cognitive science, psychology and fundamental physics?

Science and mysticism will start to merge. The greatest scientists will be those who can access non-ordinary states of consciousness and have direct insight into the nature of reality.

Science is by definition symbolic because it requires communication and coordination which cannot be done other than through language. But individual scientists can venture off by themselves and explore consciousness and bring back nuggets. The difficulty will be coordinating that with others.

Science itself will be transcended and that transcendence of it will eventually transform what science is.

No matter how much science you do, you will always be as far away from understand reality as you were before you started doing science. Because reality is infinite and science is finite. So you can do science forever and still never get any closer to the end. All scientific discovery is relative. Relative, but useful.

Neuroscience, cognitive science, psychology, and fundamental physics will admit that their discoveries are relative to certain states of consciousness. Fundamental physics is only true relative to an ordinary human state of consciousness and within a very narrow symbolic framework. All science is human species biased and ultimately imaginary. But imaginary things can still be useful. So it's useful for survival.

- - - - - -

Anyhow, this will be my last communication here. I cannot teach a student who insists he is right.

Good luck with your journey through the labyrinths of your own mind.

I wish you total awakening.

P.S. Try to really appreciate this: your mind is deliberately tricking you not to awaken. Every thought you think is already hijacked to maintain your sense of self and reality. So when you think, "Leo is wrong" << that's already the trick.

item.title: Why is health care for all a human right?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
1 hour ago, trenton said:

Can you find examples of selfishness not backfiring and actually being helpful?  One idea is selfishness teaching us not to be selfish.

Selfishness always works in the short-term but crumbles in the long-term because Truth is selfless and the self is false.

It's the same reason life always ends in death. Death is Truth so it must always win out.

item.title: Are You Enlightened?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

You guys love to play word games.

When you are fully conscious that you are God, that is enlightenment/awakening. How long it lasts is irrelevant. It could last 1 minute or 100 years. For as long as you are conscious, you are awake. As soon as you are not conscious, you are asleep.

If you are in doubt whether you're awake, you're asleep. If you have questions about what God is or means, you are asleep.

item.title: God, You and Them :: Others exist! (explained)
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Self = Other

item.title: Difference between god-self and no-self?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

They are perfectly identical.

God is that which has no self. Which makes it the One Absolute Self -- an infinite being that contains all beings.

item.title: Are You Enlightened?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
5 hours ago, TheAvatarState said:

Consider that "enlightenment" was a term created by people who weren't enlightened, to put someone else on a pedestal, or by a master to separate himself and give value.

Just no.

It was created by people who actually seriously awoke.

There is a clear difference between those who awoke and those who have not. Stop muddling the waters by saying everyone is woke.

item.title: Why is health care for all a human right?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

Look at society like a family. If your mother got cancer, you would never leave her alone to die because she couldn't pay $2,000 month for her medication while you were swimming in cash and buying million dollar vacation homes and sports cars. You would not charge your mother $70,000 for treatment.

It's just that simple.

60,000+ people die each year in America from lack of ability to pay for healthcare. Does that make any sense? Purely from a financial POV if these people didn't die think of how much tax money they would bring in over their lifetimes. It's idiotic for the government to let them die. The government is actually losing money on each death. Each person can bring in at least $5k to $10k in tax revenue each year. Not to mention the compassion angle.

item.title: How is Sam Harris not 100% yellow?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
35 minutes ago, Endangered-EGO said:

And how is he orange?

I don't feel he deeply understands Green. Because he hasn't fully gone through it.

He's very rationalistic, materialistic, and moralistic.

His political positions are problematic when he does his whole Islamophobia thing and his race IQ thing.

One of the hallmarks of Yellow is non-judgment and the ability to appreciate the relativity of different perspectives. Sam has some of that, but not too deep.

Again, he def has some Yellow, but not 100% Yellow. It's pretty pointless splitting hairs over this. You're never going to know a person's entire Spiral profile. We're just making best guesses here.

item.title: How is Sam Harris not 100% yellow?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Endangered-EGO Your notion of winning or losing debates is silly. Truth and consciousness are not things to be debated at all.

Yes, Sam Harris is more developed than JP and of course Ben Shaprio. But Sam has plenty of Orange yet in him, and he is certainly not awake.

But yes, he has a good deal of Yellow in him. But Yellow is not that high when we are talking about things like truth, consciousness, love, God, nonduality, spirituality, etc. Yellow is still childhood.

Sam Harris is very moralistic and does not understand relativity. So he hasn't fully integrated Green.

item.title: Are You Enlightened?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

It's very simple. To be fully enlightened is to realize you are God and that you create the entire universe. If you're not conscious of that, you ain't really enlightened.

If there is even one hair of separation between you and God, you're not fully awake.

How you act towards others is a tangential matter. Enlightenment is not about behavior or action, it's about consciousness of what you are. You're either conscious that you are God or you're not.

item.title: Can Enlightenment Work Cure Social Anxiety?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
19 minutes ago, dimitri said:

@Leo Gura is there "full awaken" at all? You can always be more awaken, or?

There are many degrees of it, for sure.

But I've also experienced what I would call a "full awakening". I think extremely few people have experienced it. Most gurus, teachers, and masters have not. I don't know any teacher who I consider fully awake.

item.title: philosophy or psychology in university if I love the actualized.org content?
item.description:
in Life Purpose, Career, Entrepreneurship

Your questions are directly part of the field of philosophy.

Psychology will never even attempt to answer what existence is.

But academic philosophy will also never succeed in answering what existence is. That can only be done via awakening.

You created existence. So who are you asking? You are it!

item.title: Can Enlightenment Work Cure Social Anxiety?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

If you truly, fully awake, then yes. But that's so challenging and rare that you are better off working directly on your social anxiety.

True and full awakening has the potential to cure everything. But are you willing to full awaken? Do you dare?

item.title: Shallow breath is the source of my suffering
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

Your suffering is not due to shallow breath, it's due to you attached to being you.

Suffering is attachment to a finite self.

item.title: How did you find your skill set?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
3 hours ago, Matt23 said:

It seems i'm more interested in psychology, working with people, and spirituality, so I don't really feel i have anything to work on their.

You have tons to work on there.

You're overlooking the obvious. That is your skill set.

Quote

Like it's all impractical stuff that I can't really "do" or be creative with. It's just talking with people n' thinking, etc.  More abstract.  

You can do it and you can get very creative with it. Your thinking here is just too narrow and materialistic.

Abstract is good. Gives you lots of creative room. Your mind is just lazy with being creative. It's like you've been given a blank canvas and you are complaining there's nothing to work with.

Own your passions and get to work.

item.title: Sadhguru disapproves of psychedelics
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
5 minutes ago, Lento said:

Until I see you moving mountains with your sheer will and imagination, you're just a human being with quite an imagination.

Trip well 😙

Your foolish expectations are not my problem, they are yours.

item.title: Has Anyone Here Cured A Disease Using Alternative Medicine?
item.description:
in Health, Fitness, Nutrition
21 hours ago, Rilles said:

and science doesnt believe in anecdotal evidence

Of course real science relies on anecdotal evidence all the time. That's what clinical trials are. It's just very rigorous.

But many fools have no idea how real science works.

But yet, many scientists are far too dismissive of any modality which doesn't have a simply material physical explanation. So they will accept anecdotal evidence for a new chemical drug, but they will not for something like acupuncture.

item.title: Is creativity selfish? Art and Spirituality...
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
32 minutes ago, Sleyker said:

 

Do you think that it is also true for dancing? 

I am very into salsa dancing and I am quite heavily familiar with the salsa community and I notice how everybody's priority is to look good, seek approval, rather than just enjoying the music... there's lots of ego in that world. 

So I doubt it is worthwhile to pursue it since from my perspective it doesn't align too much with spirituality which is also something I am interested in.

There's lots of ego in the world. Yet the whole world is pure spirit.

item.title: Dating Profile with a Handsome Man
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality
2 hours ago, Space said:

I understand why you think it's lazy, but you'd be a fool to not make use of it. 3 of my closest friends have had long term (1+year) relationships through the apps. It's a completely valid method for finding a partner. I don't know how much time you've spent using dating apps,

My brother got married off OkCupid.

So of course it can work.

But if you don't have the look or you want to get the best girl possible, online isn't a good strategy.

If your look is above average or your standards are low, yes, you can gets plenty of dates online.

But you can attract much hotter girls in person. The hottest girls are not found online.

item.title: sister battling opiod withdrawals, shrooms?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 hours ago, OBEler said:

you can do ibogaine at home, you just need a very trustfully trip sitter and something to puke in. nothing else. many people recovered from this.

No! Do not even think of doing that.

Opioid treatment requires a large flood dose. If you get the dose wrong you will kill yourself. This is no joke.

Iboga is not like other psychedelics. You can kill the body with this one.

item.title: Sadhguru disapproves of psychedelics
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Don't listen to people's opinions about psychedelics unless they've done 50+ trips.

You might as well be asking him his opinion about how it's like to live on Mars.

in Self-Actualization
7 minutes ago, Yog said:

Btw he admitted he has done psychedelics, never told which ones though. I assume its shrooms or ajahuasca. He likes to bring them from time to time.

To say he has done psychedelics is highly deceptive. He has toyed around with them at most and has no idea what they really are or mean.

He's too fearful and neurotic to use them properly. Same with Sam Harris.

item.title: Sadhguru about "life is a dream"? Confusion
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

To be technical about it, there is no difference between life being a dream and life being real.

Reality = dream

So you can say the glass is half full or half empty and both are right.

He is just telling you the glass is half full.

item.title: sister battling opiod withdrawals, shrooms?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Nothing comes close to ibogaine for opioid withdrawal. Ibgaine resets the brain's opioid receptors effortlessly.

Tell her to fly to Canada, Mexico, or Costa Rica to an ibogaine clinic.

Ibogaine must be administered by a nurse. You cannot do it at home.

item.title: Is creativity selfish? Art and Spirituality...
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@iridule No, silly!

Your desire for art and creativity is selflessness. That is your way of reconnecting with God. That is your church.

Your only problem is your guilt and self-judgment. Let it go and pursue your art guilt-free.

Don't let selfish people gaslight you or make you feel guilty. You fell for the gaslighting.

item.title: Thoughts of Jordan Peterson's self development models?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
7 hours ago, Applegarden said:

@Leo Gura And not only that, he doesn't seem to be very happy from what i have seen and i think that is absolutely the best indicator to see if somebody's teaching works, even at dire chronic suffering. I get that he is sick now, but even before that in those debates i watched, way too serious about life man, way to rationalizing and too attached to the events happening in the world and indulging and reinforcing limiting beliefs about reality. Depression is not something that sages express, you know. Don't get me wrong he is not stupid.

His worldview makes him neurotic, of course.

item.title: Projections, awakening and purification
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

I have young kids and because of that responsibility I still require the support of my husband to responsibly use psychedelics, which I currently do not have. It's not a convenient time in my life to be going through this but it's happening anyway.

Survival is a great excuse for not awakening, eh?

But I get it.

item.title: Dating Profile with a Handsome Man
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality
On 2/24/2020 at 11:41 AM, Forrest Adkins said:

I encourage everyone to make a Tinder profil with some regular good looking (top 10%) guy. Just leave the profile text empty, it doesnt matter.

Its a truly eye opening experiece, within hours you will get hundreds of matches and women will actively contact you. You can say the most braindead/evil/boring stuff and they wont loose interest. Just opening with "Sex?" will get a positive answer. A guy like this can arrange sex with 10+ different girls by putting in 1 hour of half assed effort.

This is totally true because online dating is 100% about looks. Nothing else matters.

When you post a pic of yourself online, that's all you're reducing yourself down to.

If you are not a classically handsome guy, this is a terrible strategy for you because you are not displaying your other great qualities. Your strategy must be to get hot girls in-person with your personality, not your looks. Girls respond very differently in-person.

Online is the lazy man's game. If you are lazy with game, don't be surprised when your results look lazy too.

The bulk of a man's attractiveness is in his personality and the life he's built. So to reduce yourself to a profile pic is like selling a diamond at a dollar store.

item.title: You can literally sit in nature as an occupation
item.description:
in Life Purpose, Career, Entrepreneurship
On 2/22/2020 at 6:34 AM, Mada_ said:

Does anyone on here do regular solo camping? Or have experience with bushcraft? If so, can you maintain spiritual practice in the wilderness? Obviously meditation would be easy, but I've always wondered whether it would be possible to do a solo bush retreat, and maintain a Hatha yoga practice. Perhaps I will take this on as my own challenge.

In practice you will be so busy just surviving in the wilderness that you will have very little time for true meditation.

Meditation requires completely detaching from survival. So it's actually easier to do in a well furnished home where most of your survival needs are easily handled. Ideally you'd have someone else even cook your food, so you don't get distracted. Even taking a shit is a distraction.

Notice just how much survival distracts you.

Of course if you just love camping or want to do it professionally, by all means. But don't confuse that with consciousness work.

item.title: Projections, awakening and purification
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
8 hours ago, mandyjw said:

My question is, umm, well... can I avoid this somehow?  And still grow? Is there an easy button? 

There is.

Take a psychedelic with the intention to become conscious of all your projections, assumptions, and judgments. And be ready for a beating.

And while you're at it, become conscious of what "other" is. You may be shocked to discover that other itself is nothing but your projection.

item.title: Why do (some) stage Green follow Communism
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
8 minutes ago, Hansu said:

@Leo Gura @Teejay

Why don't these people then distinguish themselves from traditional communism?

Even modern facists clearly distinguish themselves from the "nazis" we know from history books

First of all, they do. The problem is that the audience listening isn't intetested in making such a distinction. Conservatives and centrists like to play dumb because that serves the status quo. It serves Michael Bloomberg to think Bernie is a communist. It serves Jordan Peterson to think that trans activists are in the same category as Stalin and Lenin. Of course this is absurd. But they cannot see it because their careers and realities depend on them not seeing it.

Secondly, even Bernie and others like him are not conscious enough to understand what a distinction is. So they don't fully understand that the audience lacks the distinctions they have. Bernie takes his distinctions for granted.

It's one thing to make a distinction, and it's a whole nother thing to know you've made a distinction and that the people you're speaking with haven't made it in their minds. That's some next level stage Yellow and Turquoise shit. Very, very few humans on this planet understand such subtle things. And it's not like you could explain it in a 2 minute CNN segment.

Most of you here still have no idea what a distinction is, and you have been studying this stuff for years.

item.title: Has Anyone Here Cured A Disease Using Alternative Medicine?
item.description:
in Health, Fitness, Nutrition
On 2/21/2020 at 2:04 AM, Rilles said:

Acupuncture, Reiki, Moxibustion, TCM, Reflexology, Herbs

Here's a very basic fact to contemplate:

If these things did not work for some people, they would not exist.

The trick is finding out if they work for your particular problem. They may, or may not. It depends on hundreds of factors. And the only way you'll know is by testing it yourself.

Health issues can be very, very complex.

item.title: On Leo's comments at 6:00 in How Psychedelics Work
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@wheelspawn Stop thinking and just notice that your mind is attached to a position and blindly defending it. You can feel this inside yourself if you introspect genuinely.

If your keep speaking from a closed mind, don't be surprised if you get banned. You're walking right on the edge. It seems from your POV that you're being intelligent and reasonable, but you are speaking from ignorance. I don't know how else to get you to understand this.

Once again, open your mind. People here are trying to telling you about a radical truth which you have no understanding of yet. It's not personal. You just don't comprehend the depth of what consciousness is because you are asleep.

It's like you are a dog and we are pointing to the moon and you keep biting the finger. You are missing the moon entirely. But your mind is fooling you into thinking that you know best and that you can rationalize and argue your way out of this problem. You can't. It takes the guidance of an awakened being to show you that you are asleep. But that cannot happen if your mind is closed and you keep insisting that you know best.

You are inside of a dream. And everything your mind says maintains the "reality" of that dream. Your mind will defend, to the death, your dream. Which is what you have been doing this entire thread. But you're not conscious that you're doing it. Either start to wake up or this forum is not for you. This is a waking up forum. Arguing and reasoning will not wake you up. You have yet to realize that.

If you have an emotional reaction to anything said here, just notice that, rather than acting from it. Those emotional reactions are your mind fooling you into staying asleep. You are ideologically attached to the notion of an objective reality because your entire life hinges on it, and yet it is entirely a fiction of your mind.

My words are not something for you to believe or disbelieve, but to investigate. You can validate everything simply by carefully and patiently observing how your own mind works. Waking up is not a function of believing new things. All beliefs are part of the dream your mind creates. So is rationality, logic, science, and religion.

You have to realize that there is something extremely profound that I am trying to communicate to you right now. But you have to really open your mind first in order to start to get it.

If you fail to get the communication, that's okay. I understand. But you then need to understand that we are not going to waste our time babysitting you and over-explaining things to you here. Our time is better invested in helping those whose minds are open enough to hear the communication.

item.title: Why do (some) stage Green follow Communism
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

Old school Soviet style communism of the Leninist stripe is more stage Blue than Green.

Few people have the cognitive frameworks necessary to distinguish the difference between Blue vs Green or old-school communism vs Bernie-style Democratic Socialism.

Even well-educated professors like Jordan Peterson fail to make such distinctions. Because their minds are closed and locked in various paradigms.

Very, very few humans think for themselves. Mostly humans just ape other humans.

item.title: Magic mushrooms vs other psychedelics for spiritual development?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@robinmk4l Shrooms will more than knock your socks off.

But 5-MeO-DMT is beyond words.

Shrooms have no limit to their potency. You can eat as much as your stomach can hold and trips forever higher. Your mind will not be able to handle it. So there's no glass ceiling potency-wise. The ceiling is your fragile mind.

Shroom are quite challenging at higher doses. Otherwise psychedelics like 5-MeO-DMT are easier because they are clearer. Shrooms can be wacky, twisted, and confusing.

But everyone needs to experience shrooms at least a few times in their life. They have a very magical earthy mystical quality.

item.title: The 5-MeO-DMT Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Just want to report, 5-MeO-DMT freebase mixes well with coconut milk for plugging. The milk can reduce the burn. A few drops is all you need.

Freebase also mixes fully in basic cooking vinegar. But vineger will sting your ass more than coconut milk. Still, not bad at all.

You can also experiment mixing freebase in MCT oil. But oil will tend to stick more to any plastic surface like your mixing container, stirring device, and inside of the needless syringe, thus slightly reducing your dose.

Coconut milk is nice in that it isn't sticky like oil.

Coconut milk can also be used to reduce the pain of snorting. But you'd be a fool to snort anything once you master plugging.

item.title: What distinguishes science or religious, etc. "beliefs" from everything here?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Roy What you're missing is that Absolute Truth exists. And it is absolutely Absolute.

You can be 100% conscious of what everything is. But not through science, relgion, or belief.

The map is not the territory.

The real work is to stop with the maps and become the territory.

item.title: Why are humans concious but rocks aren’t?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Mongu9719 You're overlooking the obvious: the human body is NOT conscious!

Your body has exactly as much consciousness as a rock. The only difference is, you think you are a body whereas a rock does not think it is a rock.

The reason it doesn't make sense to you is because you assume you were born. This is the key mistake. A rock isn't burdened by such an assumption.

Your birth is imaginary. As a result of imagining your birth, you imagine consciousness belongs to you but not to a rock.

You misunderstand the rock because you misunderstand yourself. And you misunderstand yourself because otherwise you could not be born! Your birth itself is a misunderstanding.

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 hour ago, TDW1995 said:

@Leo Gura So, the computer that I'm looking at right now exists for itself, but it sure feels like it relies on a perceiver, otherwise it wouldn't exist (for example, if I left my office). I guess this requires overcoming naive realism, which is something else I'm trying to grasp.

There is no you.

That's what you're missing.

This stuff happening now is not "your life". Ego is usurping appearances to construct "a life."

All appearances ARE the self.

item.title: The 5-MeO-DMT Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
7 minutes ago, Arzack said:

I don't know Leo, I tried sub-breakthrough doses a shit-ton of times and they just make me feel bad (proportional to the dose taken). I honestly don't think it's just a self-fulling prophecy,

 

People react to 5-MeO-DMT very differently.

In your case I would suggest trying other psychedelics until you find one which suits you and feels good to you. Psychedelics are not supposed to feel like hell every time. They are supposed to feel wonderful. It's important to find the substance which fits you.

Maybe after that you can revisit 5-MeO.

Some chemicals just don't sit right with your body. The body metabolizes chemicals in different ways. Don't assume that all people are the same.

Quote

maybe it's different for you because you're an older soul than me (more reincarnations, a Michael Teaching concept)?

Yes, many psychics have told me that I'm an old soul. Not sure if this plays a role, but it might.

item.title: Experience psychedelics sooner or later?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Have you considered that your depression is actually a disconnection from being and consciousness?

Your pursuit of sober, practical reality is what makes you depressed, because survival is fundamentally hollow and unsatisfying. You are a hamster in a wheel.

item.title: please help me build a foundation for gathering knowledge (what is right/wrong?)
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

Definitely more philosophical.

This is the branch of philosophy known as epistemology. It tries to answer the question: How do we know anything at all?

Psychology doesn't go as deep. But also philosophy tends to do a lot of mental masturbation on this topic.

Learning to accurately distinguish truth from falsehood is the most challenging endeavor the human mind can undertake because it is the linchpin which holds together reality.

If you fully understood it, your entire sense of physical reality would collapse and you would experience "death". So very few people accurate get that far.

You are not going to reach Truth via university studies. Truth is far too radical for that.

item.title: please help me build a foundation for gathering knowledge (what is right/wrong?)
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
4 minutes ago, LoveandPurpose said:

So there is a way to know that relative truth about capitalism?

There are ways to be less ignorant about capitalism and relative things.

Quote

What are good books about epistemology?

Not many good ones. You can find a few on my book list.

I'm working to correct that.

Quote

I'm trying to figure out my Life Purpose right now and Understanding is one of my top values.

Then you should be eager to read, learn, research, and contemplate stuff.

Be open ended. You don't know what you'll discover.

Quote

And believe me I admit that I don't know. I feel like I don't know anything about this world (for sure).

Good. But not nearly enough.

Not-knowing is not just about admitting it, it's a whole lifestyle and state of mind.

Try sitting for 5 minutes and just basking in I-don't-knowness.

item.title: please help me build a foundation for gathering knowledge (what is right/wrong?)
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
4 minutes ago, LoveandPurpose said:

@Leo Gura I don't particularly mean a foundation about the nature of reality.

I mean knowing how filter out wrong from right knowledge. Knowing about self-bias, ideology, spiral dynamics helps and I wonder if there's similar models/theories on that.

One person says capitalism is good. The other person says capitalism is the best system that's out there. Others say that a different, more modern form of it would be better. How can I know which one is true without reading 100 books on capitalism?

You can't know that ahead of time! That's the point.

You are asking for an epistemic foundation. The nature of reality is intimately tied with everything else so it should to be avoided here.

If you admit you don't know, you might be motivated to read some books on capitalism.

Yes, it takes work. You want a shortcut. And I am trying to show you that a shortcut here is a mistake. There is no shortcut for learning to distinguish truth from falsehood.

The nature of reality is entangled with how you think about reality and with your survival. If these things were seperate, everything would be easy.

item.title: please help me build a foundation for gathering knowledge (what is right/wrong?)
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@LoveandPurpose

But you are asking for a foundation. Do you want a foundating grounded in truth or falsehood? If truth, then your foundation must be not-knowing because that is most true for you. You do not know how to distinguish truth from falsehood. But if you want a foundation grounded in falsehood, then proceed as you were.

I am not speaking of the Absolute here. I am speaking very practically. You do not know how to distinguish truth from falsehood even in the relative domain.

For example, you do not even know if the Earth is flat. This has serious implications in the relative domain.

I am not even talking about the Absolute here. You are so far from the Absolute that it's nothing but a fantasy for you at this point.

Notice that a lot of epistemic mistakes are made in relative domain.

If you want a foundation, it's best that your foundation not be based on falsehood. No one can give you a foundation because how would you know what they gave you is true? A foundation can only be derived by yourself through personal inquiry and contemplation.
